About

FunnelFire arose from a desire to help sales and account managers manage the firehose of outside data that can help them excel. The company was born from a frustration the founders, sales veterans, had trying to juggle pre-call prep work, account tracking and ongoing outreach.

FunnelFire helps companies make more money by empowering their salespeople to sell more effectively. By combining a sales best practices framework with a robust data platform, sales teams can effortlessly research, monitor and contact their accounts in a proactive, value-added manner.

FunnelFire's proprietary real-time technology platform aggregates and analyzes news, press releases, SEC, social and other data from over 50K sources on the industries, companies and people that sales people target.

Our Team

Justin Smithline

CEO

Justin has spent over 15 years growing successful enterprise technology companies with a focus on sales, product, and marketing. FunnelFire is his 3rd company. Prior to FunnelFire, Justin started Instinctiv, a mobile media company that was acquired by Soundcloud and also Linguaflex, a medical device for the treatment of sleep apnea that’s now in Phase III clinical trials.

Justin also helped lead the successful carve out and turnaround of Backstage, a leading B2B media portal for the acting community, where he lead all sales, product and technology.

Justin holds an MBA from Cornell University.

Mark LaRosa

CRO

Mark LaRosa has been a sales executive and entrepreneur his entire career. Mark is a sought out expert in start-up sales, has brought many companies from zero sales to profitability. He is the author of Sales, Swingers & Start-ups: Practical Stories to ensure startup success, and continues his writing on both the FunnelFire and QuotaCrush blogs.

When not working on FunnelFire, Mark is the Chairman of the Board of the Hugh O’Brian Youth Leadership Foundation, an international non-profit focused on promoting youth leadership. Mark holds a BS in MIS from Stevens Institute of Technology.

David Pfeffer

CTO

David Pfefer is a software enthusiast, professor, and technology wizard. Having successfully created the android (and programmed it to dream about electric sheep), David Pfeffer has been spending time focused on retiring rogue robots.

As a hobby, David Pfeffer enjoys making carnitas and overlooking the factory where he shelled peanuts as his first job, which he has since expanded into a butcher's-shop-and-almond-factory.

Phil Barresi

Frontend Engineer
